topics.topic_title: Litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (Oral Literature)

sub_topics.title: Misebezi ni butokwa bwa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (Functions of oral literature)
competences: Batomahanye misebezi ni butokwa bwa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo

teacher_steps: Akenye bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya kuikupuza likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Alaele bana ba sikolo kukolohanya litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (prose)
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kuikambota misebezi ni butokwa bwa litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (prose)
learner_steps: Baikupuze likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Bakolohanye litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (prose)
Baikambote misebezi ni butokwa bwa litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (prose)
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kukolohanya misebezi ni butokwa bwa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo; zeambolwa (prose). Functions include: Kubukeleza ni kushimbulula sizo, Kutumisa sizo, Kufa tuto yeama muinelo/mupilelo wa batu, Kuhatiseza tamahano ni buñwi, Kuikambota ni kufitisa maikuto, Kuitabisa, Kufitisa lituto za bupilo, Kubukeleza likezo ni litaba za baikale.

teacher_steps: Akenye bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya kuikupuza litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Alaele bana ba sikolo kukolohanya litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kuikambota misebezi ni butokwa bwa litopa
learner_steps: Baikupuze litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Bakolohanye litopa za likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Baikambote misebezi ni butokwa bwa litopa
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kukolohanya misebezi ni butokwa bwa litopa za likalulo. Prose forms: Matangu (Myths, Legendary, Fairy tales, Fable), Makande (Legendary, Epics, Fairy tales). Poetry forms: Ballads, Lyrics, Odes, Monologue. Drama forms: Comedy, Tragedy, Farce, Horror, Puppetry.

sub_topics.short_notes: Oral literature encompasses three main forms: Prose (narratives), Poetry (songs/lyrics), and Drama (performance). Each form has specific functions including cultural preservation, moral instruction, entertainment, and social commentary.

questions: Kuikupuza likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Kukolohanya misebezi ni butokwa bwa litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Kuikambota misebezi ni butokwa bwa litopa za likalulo
Expected standard: Misebezi ni butokwa bwa likalulo ikolohanyiwe kaswanelo

sub_topics.title: Toloko ya likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo (Interpretation of oral literature)
competences: Batoloke likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo

teacher_steps: Alaele bana ba sikolo kutosa lika zesupa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Afe bana ba sikolo musebezi wakunyakisisa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
learner_steps: Batose lika zesupa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Banyakisise likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutosa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo. Forms include: tongue twisters, riddles, sayings, proverbs, idioms, songs/poetry, narratives, myths. Features: figurative language, repetition, oral narratives, symbolism, oral transmission.

teacher_steps: Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kualunguta likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Alaele bana ba sikolo kubatisisa ni kufumana tuso ya likalulo
learner_steps: Baalungute likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Babatisise ni kufumana tuso ya likalulo
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutalusa likalulo. Tongue twisters: phrases difficult to articulate. Riddles: puzzles requiring thought. Proverbs: wise sayings with cultural wisdom. Idioms: expressions with special meanings. Legends: stories of historical events.

teacher_steps: Alaele bana ba sikolo kualunguta tuso ya litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo kwa litaba za bupilo
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kunyakisisa moo likalulo likona kuitusisezwa kwa litaba za bupilo
learner_steps: Baalungute tuso ya litilica kwa litaba za bupilo
Banyakisise moo likalulo likona kuitusisezwa kwa litaba za bupilo
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kuitusisa likalulo kwa litaba za bupilo. Applications: teaching life lessons, developing wisdom, during ceremonies, in moral instruction, for entertainment and education.

sub_topics.short_notes: Interpretation of oral literature involves identifying, explaining, and applying various forms to real-life situations. These include tongue twisters, riddles, proverbs, idioms, songs, and narratives that transmit cultural wisdom.

vocabulary.definition: Tongue twisters - difficult phrases to articulate
Riddles - puzzles requiring thought to solve

questions: Kutosa lika zesupa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Kunyakisisa likalulo za litilica yeitusisa kubulela ka mulomo
Kualunguta tuso ya litilica kwa litaba za bupilo
Expected standard: Likalulo liitusiswe kwa litaba za bupilo kakuluka

sub_topics.title: Likalulo za litilica yeñozwi (Forms of written literature)

teacher_steps: Afe bana ba sikolo musebezi wa kubatisisa likalulo za litilica yeñozwi
Kufa bana ba sikolo libuka za litilica ka mifuta yazona (prose, poetry, drama)
Kulaela bana ba sikolo kunyaka libuka zeo ni kufumana shutano
Ataluseze bana ba sikolo kuli likalulo za litilica yeñozwi ki zetaalu (prose, poetry ni drama)
learner_steps: Banyake libuka zebafilwe ni kufumana shutano
Batomahanye lishutano zebatosize
Babapanye lishutano ni libuka zebafilwe
Baalule libuka kuya ka moliswanela
Basupe buka ni kubulela kalulo ya litilica yateñi
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutosa likalulo za litilica yeñozwi. Prose: narratives in paragraphs. Poetry: verses with special language. Drama: plays in acts and scenes with dialogue.

teacher_steps: Alaele bana ba sikolo kueza lipatisiso za litaluso za lipulelo ni manzwi
Baitusise libuka ni makepe a intaneti kubatisisa litaluso
Alaele bana ba sikolo kutoloka likalabo za lipatisiso zabona mwa Silozi
Atuse bana ba sikolo kukona kuipupela litoloko zabona
learner_steps: Baeze lipatisiso za litaluso
Batoloke likalabo za lipatisiso zabona mwa Silozi
Bafitise likalabo za lipatisiso zabona
Baalakanye litoloko zabona za kuikupulela
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutoloka likalulo za litilica yeñozwi. Students research definitions in English and translate to Silozi for prose, poetry, and drama.

sub_topics.short_notes: Forms of written literature include Prose (novels, stories in paragraphs), Poetry (verses with rhythmic language), and Drama (plays organized in acts and scenes). Each has distinct structural and stylistic characteristics.

vocabulary.definition: Written literature - literature in written form

questions: Kutomahanya mifuta ya litilica yeñozwi
Kueza lipatisiso ni kufumana litoloko
Kufa toloko ya kalulo ni kalulo ya litilica yeñozwi
Expected standard: Mifuta ya litilica yeñozwi itolokwe kaswanelo

sub_topics.title: Litopa za likalulo za litilica yeñozwi (Classes of written literature)
competences: Baalule litilica yeñozwi mwa likalulo zayona

teacher_steps: Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kuikupuza likalulo za litilica yeñozwi
Atiiseze toloko yefilwe ki bana ba sikolo kuama kalulo ya prose
Afe bana ba sikolo litilica yeñozwi yemwa sitopa sa prose
Afe bana ba sikolo litopa za kalulo ya prose moliinezi mwa sikuwa
learner_steps: Baikupuze likalulo za litilica yeñozwi
Babale ni kunyakisisa litilica yeñozwi yemwa sitopa sa prose
Batose lika zebonisa shutano
Babeya litilica yebafilwe mwa litopa za prose
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutahisa litopa za prose. Classes: Folktales (fable, fairy tale, legend, myths), Fictional prose (novels, stories), Non-fictional prose (biographies, essays), Heroic prose (legends, tales).

sub_topics.short_notes: Classes of written literature organize forms into subcategories. Prose includes folktales, fiction, and non-fiction. Poetry includes narrative, lyric, and dramatic. Drama includes comedy, tragedy, horror, and melodrama.

questions: Kuikupuza kalulo ni toloko ya litilica yeñozwi
Kubala ni kunyakisisa litilica yeñozwi yemwa sitopa
Kutosa lika zebonisa shutano
Kubeya litilica yeñozwi yebafilwe mwa litopa
Expected standard: Litopa linyakisiswe kakuluka

topics.topic_title: Manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica (Literary terms and devices)

sub_topics.title: Mifuta ya manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica (Types of literary terms)
competences: Bataluhanye mifuta ya manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica

teacher_steps: Afe bana ba sikolo musebezi wakubatisisa kuli manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica ki manzwi acwañi
Alaele bana ba sikolo kufa litaluso za likalabo zabona mwa Silozi
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kualunguta likalabo zebafumani
Aabele bana ba sikolo libuka zena ni literary terms and devices
learner_steps: Babatisise kuli manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica ki likamañi
Bafe litaluso za likalabo zabona mwa Silozi
Baalungute likalabo zebafumani
Bafumane manzwi ni lipulelo mwa libuka zefilwe
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutosa mifuta ya manzwi aitusiswa mwa litilica. Types include: Allegory, Alliteration, Imagery, Satire, Irony, Simile, Metaphor, Onomatopoeia, Personification, Symbolism.

teacher_steps: Akenye bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya kuikupuza manzwi ni lipulelo
Afe bana ba sikolo musebezi wakubatisisa litoloko
Alaele bana ba sikolo kufa lipatisiso zabona za litoloko mwa Silozi
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kualunguta litoloko zefilwe
learner_steps: Baikupuze manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica
Babatisise litoloko za manzwi ni lipulelo
Bafe lipatisiso zabona za litoloko mwa Silozi
Baalungute litoloko zefilwe ni kulumelelana
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutoloka mifuta. Simile: comparison using 'sina'/'inge'. Metaphor: direct comparison. Onomatopoeia: words imitating sounds. Personification: giving human qualities to non-human things. Irony: saying opposite of what is meant.

teacher_steps: Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kubata manzwi ni lipulelo zenyalana ni zebaitutile
Alaele bana ba sikolo kufa mitala ya mifuta
Alaele bana ba sikolo kuekeza fa mitala yefilwe
learner_steps: Babate manzwi ni lipulelo zenyalana ni zebaitutile
Baekeze fa mitala yefilwe fa mufuta ni mufuta
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kufa mitala. Examples from Silozi literature: 'Meeno sina muzilili' (simile), 'Licolocolo mbonyi ya siloko' (metaphor), 'Dwi-dwi-dwi' (onomatopoeia), 'Lizazi lamenyeza Lubasi' (personification).

sub_topics.short_notes: Literary terms and devices are special language techniques writers use to enhance expression and create deeper meaning. They include figures of speech like simile, metaphor, personification, and sound devices like onomatopoeia.

vocabulary.definition: Saying opposite of what is meant
Giving human qualities to non-human things
Using one thing to represent another

questions: Kubatisisa kuli manzwi ni lipulelo zeitusiswa mwa litilica ki likamañi
Kufa litaluso za likalabo zabona mwa Silozi
Kualunguta likalabo zebafumani
Kufumana manzwi ni lipulelo mwa libuka zefilwe
Kuekeza fa mitala yefilwe fa mufuta ni mufuta
Expected standard: Mifuta litolokwe kakuluka

topics.topic_title: Likande - Lika zebupa likande (Story - Elements of a story)

sub_topics.title: Babanga kabelo mwa likande (Characterisation)
competences: Bataluhanye kamoo muñoli abeela babapali mwa likande

teacher_steps: Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya kutalusa characterization
Alaele bana ba sikolo kubatisisa toloko ya linzwi la characterization
Alaele bana ba sikolo kutalusa zebafumani mwa Silozi
learner_steps: Baikambote kamoo muñoli abeela babapali
Babatisise toloko ya characterization
Bataluse zebafumani mwa Silozi
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutalusa characterization. Characterization is how the writer creates and develops characters through their traits, actions, dialogue, and interactions.

teacher_steps: Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya mifuta ya babapali
Alaele bana ba sikolo kubatisisa mifuta ya babapali
Alaele bana ba sikolo kutoloka mifuta ya babapali
learner_steps: Baikambote mifuta ya babapali
Babatisise mifuta ya babapali
Batoloke mifuta ya babapali
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutoloka mifuta. Major character: central figure. Minor character: supporting role. Dynamic character: undergoes change. Static character: remains unchanged.

sub_topics.short_notes: Characterisation involves how writers create and develop characters. Character types include Major (central), Minor (supporting), Dynamic (changing), and Static (unchanging). Each type serves specific narrative functions.

vocabulary.definition: Mubapali - person or being in a story
Babanga kabelo - how characters are created

questions: Kuikambota kamoo muñoli abeela babapali
Kubatisisa toloko ya characterization
Kutalusa zebafumani mwa Silozi
Kutoloka mifuta ya babapali
Kutosa mifuta ya babapali mwa makande
Expected standard: Musebezi wa mubapali unyakisiswe kakutala

sub_topics.title: Molitatamela litaba zeinzi mwa likande (Plot)
competences: Banyakisise litaba zebupa likande lelifitiswa kakubulela ka mulomo

teacher_steps: Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kubakenya mwa ngambolo ya kutaluso linzwi la plot
Alaele bana ba sikolo kufa litaluso zebafumani
Alaele bana ba sikolo kunyakisisa litaluso mwa Silozi
learner_steps: Baikambote ni kufitisa taluso ya plot
Bafe litaluso zebafumani
Banyakisise litaluso mwa Silozi
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Toloko ya plot. Students research and define plot as the sequence of events in a story.

teacher_steps: Akenye bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya pupeho ya likande
Alaele bana ba sikolo kualunguta pupeho ya litaba
Alaele bana ba sikolo kutalusa lipupeho za litaba
learner_steps: Baikambote kamoo litaba litatamanela
Baalungute pupeho ya litaba
Bataluse lipupeho za litaba
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutalusa pupeho. Plot features: Exposition (introduction), Rising Action (development), Climax (peak), Falling Action (aftermath), Resolution (conclusion).

sub_topics.short_notes: Plot is the sequence and organization of events in a story. It includes Exposition, Rising Action, Conflict, Climax, Falling Action, and Resolution. Understanding plot structure helps analyze how stories develop.

vocabulary.definition: Kutaha kwa butata - events building to climax
Kuhohana - turning point of the story

questions: Kuikambota ni kufitisa taluso ya plot
Kufa litaluso zebafumani
Kunyakisisa litaluso mwa Silozi
Kualungute pupeho ya litaba
Kutalusa lipupeho za litaba
Expected standard: Lipupeho za litaba litalusiwe kakutala

sub_topics.title: Sibaka ni nako koliezahalela likande (Setting)

teacher_steps: Afe mwanaa sikolo kubalela babañwi likande
Abuze bana ba sikolo lipuzo zebatusa kutosa nako mwa likande
Akoñomeke litaba zeamana ni muitusisezo wa setting
learner_steps: Bateeleze likande katokomelo
Bataluhanye kuli likande liezahala lili
Bafe mabaka a likalabo kuzwelela mwa likande
Batose litaba zeamana ni nako ya mwa likande
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutosa lika zesupa nako mwa likande. Time can be: present, past, future; seasonal; historical period; or specific events.

teacher_steps: Akenye bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya kuikupuza lika zesupa setting
Afe mwanaa sikolo kubalela babañwi likande
Abuze bana ba sikolo lipuzo zeamana ni setting ya likande
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kualunguta likalabo
learner_steps: Baikupuze lika zesupa setting mwa likande
Bateeleze likande katokomelo
Baalungute likalabo zeamana ni setting ya likande
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutosa setting mwa likande lelifilwe. Students identify time, place, and atmosphere in given stories.

teacher_steps: Akenye bana ba sikolo mwa ngambolo ya kutatulula setting
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kualunguta zemwa likande zekona kuamiwa ki setting
Aitusise mitala ya makande kutoloka moo setting iama fa lika zeinzi
Abeleke ni bana ba sikolo kutatulula setting
learner_steps: Batoloke lika zemwa likande zekona kuamiwa ki setting
Bafe mitala yebonisa mikwa moo lika likona kuamiwa ki setting
Bateeleze likande lelibaliwa kapa kukandekiwa
Batose lika zekona kuamiwa ki setting
Babonise mitala yebonisa lika zekona kuamiwa ki setting
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Kutatulula setting mwa likande lelifilwe. Setting affects characters, themes, and plot development. Changes in setting can drive character development and plot progression.

sub_topics.short_notes: Setting encompasses time (when) and place (where) a story occurs. It includes physical location, time period, season, social context, and atmosphere. Setting influences character development, plot, and themes.

vocabulary.definition: Sibaka ni nako - time and place of story events
Time - when events occur (present, past, future, season, era)

questions: Kutaluhanye kuli likande liezahala lili
Kufa mabaka a likalabo kuzwelela mwa likande
Kutosa litaba zeamana ni nako ya mwa likande
Kutaluhanye kuli likande liezahalela kai
Kutosa litaba zeamana ni sibaka mwa likande
Kutatulula setting mwa likande lelifilwe
Expected standard: Setting itatubiwe ka swanelo mwa likande lelifilwe
